pageContext.claim: “Yes, I am [speaking to HUD about homelessness in California cities]. We can't let Los Angeles, San Francisco and numerous other cities destroy themselves by allowing what's happening. And I'm speaking to tenants -- in some cases foreign people, foreign tenants -- but they have where they're tenants in buildings throughout various cities in California, and other places ... where they want to leave the country. They can't believe what's happening. Where our policeman that are on the beat are getting sick. They're actually sick. They're going to the hospital. We can't let that happen.”
pageContext.analysis: There's quite a lot going on here. Trump starts by making the grossly exaggerated claim that California cities could "destroy themselves" by allowing homelessness. Then he makes the highly dubious claim that foreign tenants are considering leaving the country because of homelessness in California cities. Then he claims police are getting sick from coming into contact with the homeless, apparently based on a single incident. A police union said three Los Angeles police officers contracted a Staph infection after attending a homeless individual at a police station. "But Dr. Brad Spellberg, chief medical officer at LAC+USC Medical Center, said it’s unfair – and inaccurate – to pin blame on any one source," a local CBS affiliate reported. They quoted Spellberg saying, “You wouldn't be able to say that it came from one person or another. It’s everywhere around us.”
